article.headline: Siena 82, Canisius 70
article.story: ALBANY, N.Y. -- Edwin Ubiles scored 22 points to lead Siena to an 82-70 win over Canisius on Monday night. Ubiles, who was named the Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference Player of the Week, shot 10-for-18 from the field for the Saints (13-4, 6-0 MAAC). Ryan Rossiter added 15 points and 14 rebounds, while Ronald Moore contributed 14 points and 11 assists for Canisius. Frank Turner finished with 23 points for the Golden Griffins (8-9, 3-3). Rishawn Johnson chipped in with 13 points. A free throw from Turner cut Siena's lead to 68-60 with 8:54 remaining in the game. But Canisius would only score two points over the next 5 minutes, and Siena went on a 10-2 run to take a 78-62 lead with 4:41 left. The Saints, who have now won seven in a row, shot 49.2 percent from the field (32-for-65). Sinea was outrebounded 36-34 in the contest, but made 10 of 19 3-point shot attempts (52.6 percent).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
